abstracts.abstract:
Existing law, the family temporary disability insurance program, provides up to 8 weeks of wage replacement benefits to workers who take time off work to care for a seriously ill child, spouse, parent, grandparent, grandchild, sibling, or domestic partner, or to bond with a minor child within one year of birth or placement in connection with foster care or adoption, or to participate in a qualifying exigency related to the covered active duty or call to covered active duty of the individual's spouse, domestic partner, child, or parent in the Armed Forces of the United States. Existing law defines certain terms for these purposes.

This bill would make a nonsubstantive change to those definition provisions.

actions.description: From printer. May be heard in committee March 21.

extras.impact_clause: An act to amend Section 3302.1 of the Unemployment Insurance Code, relating to unemployment insurance.
